thread.title: Donald Trump Jr. Hits Media Over Super Bowl Predictions
thread.title_full: Donald Trump Jr. Hits Media Over Super Bowl Predictions

author: Charles Campbell
title: Donald Trump Jr. Hits Media Over Super Bowl Predictions
text:
Donald Trump Jr. Hits Media Over Super Bowl Predictions "Where have I seen ...?" Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Donald Trump Jr. couldn’t help but take a jab at the media after predictions regarding the Super Bowl outcome turned out to be widely wrong. 
In a history-making comeback, the New England Patriots beat the Atlanta Falcons in what had previously looked like a done deal. 
Citing a Wall Street Journal analysis that was released at halftime, Trump Jr. responded, “Where have I see stats like this before???” Advertisement - story continues below 
— Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) February 6, 2017 Where have I seen stats like this before??? đđşđ¸đşđ¸đşđ¸ https://t.co/2KNR5BlTFE 
— Donald Trump Jr. (@DonaldJTrumpJr) February 6, 2017 
For good measure, Trump drove the point home by tweeting a screenshot of his previous message and captioning it with, “In case you forgot…” Advertisement - story continues below 
Trump, 39, was drawing parallels between the media’s predictions of Super Bowl LI and their predictions for the 2016 presidential race. 
Leading up to the election, almost every major news outlet claimed the odds were stacked against Donald Trump, with the majority of polls indicating a sweeping victory by then Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton. 
After Trump was declared victorious, internet users began to assemble past media clips of notable pundits and politicians predicting Trump’s demise. The end result portrayed the mainstream press as incompetent and out of touch with the general public. Advertisement - story continues below
